title: Flight from Dallas: New Evidence of CIA Involvement in the Murder of President John F. Kennedy
description: Flight from Dallas presents factual documentation of the experience of Robert G. Vinson, an Air Force Sergeant with a crypto-security clearance who was working for the North American Air Defense Command (NORAD) when on November 22, 1963, he personally and accidentally became involved in an activity connected with the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. The involvements of elements of he CIA are clearly set forth including the forced transfer of Vinson to a secret CIA base. Compelled to remain silent due to a secrecy agreement, Vinson went public after the passage of the ARRB Act in 1993. Finding it impossible to obtain assistance from government agencies including the FBI and Department of Justice, this book is his story.
author: James P. Johnston
